text: Not sure this is the best place to ask this but has anyone ever found a way to integrate custom HTML into a HubSpot CTA? We normally use image CTAs but these never have hover effects, I've looked at HubSpot CTA Buttons but I like the ability to have link blocking so the whole CTA target is clickable. I would love it if I could create an HTML panel and have it inject into a page via the CTA tool so it would act as a CTA and be trackable etc. Any ideas if this is possible?
Custom HTML - no, i donâ€™t think so, but you can implement custom CSS and/or create some classes which you can apply to the CTA.

I used to put complete bootstap html inside a cta so the entire panel would be clickable...

example:
```<div class="row-fluid"><div class="span4 cta-image"><img class="responsive" src="stupidPretneedEbookCover.jpg"></div><div class="span8 cta-content"><h4 class="nomarg">Download this ebook</h4><p class="nomarg">Yes you want this</p><p class="align-center"><span class="btn btn-orange btn-invert">Download Ebook Bow</span></p></div></div>```
You would then just use your base css file to create the css for it
it will all be wrapped inside the same html markup for a cta

If you set Button Style to `Link (no style)` you can just write raw html in the button content source code.

All of my HubSpot ctas are custom HTML
